title: Team Assistant, Europe
content:
We’re looking for a Team Assistant, Europe to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?
Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients’ real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.
What You'll Do

Personal assistant responsibilities: 

Day to day diary management; prioritizing internal and external meeting arrangements 
Preparing draft documents for review, using Google Suite 
Coordinate travel arrangements and travel expenses ensuring proactive arrangements are made efficiently
Liaising with wider stakeholders to prepare agendas, take and distribute minutes for internal meetings, plan team events and support wider ad-hoc team projects



Oversee and maintain all office management duties for a growing team including: 

Monitor post and deliveries to the office, scanning and sending on to recipients
Liaise with Facilities Manager & maintenance contractors attending to the office
Monitor hot desks, ensuring equipment is in place and liaise with IT as required
Act as first point of contact for all reception and/or hospitality tasks including organizing catering, arranging & providing food/refreshments where needed and support visitors during internal events 
Provide administrative and operational support for meetings and conference rooms 
Support other ad hoc tasks as reasonably required within the scope of the role
Support procurement process including vendor onboarding and processing incoming invoices

Be physically in the office a minimum of 3 days per week

Who You Are
You're a calm and confident person who likes to bring order to chaos. In addition, you’ve got high attention to detail with at least 5 years of experience as senior personal assistant supporting teams across Europe. 

You are proficient in Google Suite 
You have a high attention to detail
You have a proven ability to proactively and efficiently respond toto changing priorities
You have excellent organizational skills
You are pragmatic and you have a professional approach
You are fluent in both English and German

Extra credit 

You have Startup and/or experience in a hyper-growth organization 

Who We Are
Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.
